definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Baobab trees frame a serene view of night skies in Tarangire National Park, Tanzania.
sentences.chinese: 坦桑尼亚塔兰吉雷国家公园夜空下猴面包树的画面。

sentences.english: An old tree has such a huge, hollow trunk, that it can hold many people.
sentences.chinese: 一棵老猴面包树的巨大的空心树干可以容纳许多人。

sentences.english: Nelson always had baobab leaves for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 纳尔逊的早餐是猴面包树叶子。

sentences.english: Before they grow so big, the baobabs start out by being little.
sentences.chinese: 猴面包树在长大之前，开始也是小小的。

sentences.english: Then it follows that they also eat baobabs?
sentences.chinese: 因此，它们也吃猴面包树罗？

sentences.english: When I made the drawing of the baobabs I was carried beyond myself by the inspiring force of urgent necessity.
sentences.chinese: 而当我画猴面包树时，有一种急切的心情在激励着我。

sentences.english: Palm trees and baobabs are two types of trees.
sentences.chinese: 棕榈树和猴面包树是两种类型的树木。

sentences.english: "That is strictly correct, " I said. "But why do you want the sheep to eat the little baobabs ?"
sentences.chinese: 不错。可是为什么你想叫你的羊去吃小猴面包树呢？

sentences.english: When a baobab gets old its trunk becomes hollow.
sentences.chinese: 到猴面包树老了，树干就空了。

sentences.english: It was in this way that I heard, on the third day, about the catastrophe of the baobabs.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，第三天我就了解到关于猴面包树的悲剧。

sentences.english: But why do you want the sheep to eat the little baobabs?
sentences.chinese: 可是为什么你想叫你的羊去吃小猴面包树呢？

sentences.english: Today our programme is about the baobab tree.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们的节目是关于猴面包树。

definition: see 猴麵包樹|猴面包树[hou2 mian4 bao1 shu4]
coco de mer or "sea coconut" (Lodoicea maldivica)

pinyin: Ma3 da2 jia1 si1 jia1 Dao3
